popt4jlib.MSSC

Class GMeansMTClusterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC.GMeansMTClusterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClustererIntf

    public final class GMeansMTClusterer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClustererIntf
    class implements multi-threaded version of the (hard) K-Means algorithm, in a thread-safe manner. Hard version of the K-Means algorithm means that every vector to be clustered will belong to one and only one cluster. If the clusterVectors() method is called with parameters set up so that more than 1 thread of control will concurrently execute, the output clustering is guaranteed to be deterministic only if the parameter "gmeansmt.projectonempty" is false (default), else it's not due to thread-scheduling that may result in a different total ordering of the data points being examined and assigned in the first step of any given major iteration. This ordering in the standard K-Means algorithm is irrelevant, but in this version of the K-Means algorithm, if the above-mentioned parameter is set to true, then ordering becomes important because if a cluster is left with only a single data point in it within the range of points a thread is responsible for, then the data point is not allowed to move so as not to leave the cluster empty. Therefore, in such a case, the ordering in which data points are looked at, becomes important. With a single thread of control, the output is always the same given the same initial clustering and the same data points sequence.

    Notes:

    • 2018-11-13: _clusterIndices initialization where each center gets one point assigned to it before threads start executing, now only occurs when the "gmeansmt.projectonempty" parameter flag is true.
    • 2018-11-08: added barrier in GMClustererAux.go1() in the beginning of the RUN_ASGNS phase, so that the initialization of the _numi array elements is correct in each thread.
    • 2016-01-27: modified data structures to List interface from Vector to avoid synchronized access to array elements.
    • 2016-01-27: Also, moved auxiliary classes within the GMeansMTClusterer class so as to restrict all data members access control to private.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  GMeansMTClusterer.GMClustererAux
      nested auxiliary class to the GMeansMTClusterer class implementing the hard 2-step process of K-Means clustering, taking into account constraints on vectors that must not be moved (if they exist), and requirements for non-null clusters as well.
      (package private) class  GMeansMTClusterer.GMClustererThread
      nested auxiliary class to the GMeansMTClusterer class, implementing the threads to be used in K-Means computations.

      • clusterVectors

        public java.util.List clusterVectors()
                              throws ClustererException
        the most important method of the class. Some parameters must have been previously passed in the _params map (call setParams(p) to do that). These are:
        • <"gmeansmt.TerminationCriteria",ClustererTerminationIntf> the object that will decide when to stop the iterations. Mandatory.
        • <"gmeansmt.evaluator",EvaluatorIntf> the object that will evaluate a clustering. Mandatory.
        • <"gmeansmt.movable",Vector<Integer clusterind> > optional, indicates which clusters are allowed to exchange their documents, if it exists. Default is null.
        • <"gmeansmt.numthreads",Integer nt> optional, how many threads will be used to compute the clustering, default is 1.
        • <"gmeansmt.projectonempty",Boolean> optional, if false then whenever a cluster becomes empty the vector furthest away from any other center will become the new center, else the whenever a point is the last in a cluster and about to be moved out, it is prevented from doing so. Default is false.
        • <"gmeansmt.trycompacting",Double factor> optional, if it exists, indicates a factor by which (at what would be the normal end of a clustering process) the average distance of any data point from its assigned cluster center must be multiplied and be greater than the actual distance of a data point from its nearest cluster center in order for this point to be "broken away" from its assigned cluster; after all such "distant" points have been "freed", the cluster centers are re-computed, the free data points are re-assigned to their new nearest centers, and the stopping criteria are re-evaluated to see if the clustering process must continue or not. Default is null.
        Also, before calling the method, the documents to be clustered must have been added to the class object via addAllVectors(Vector<VectorIntf>) or via repeated calls to addVector(VectorIntf d), and an initial clustering must be available via a call to setInitialClustering(Vector<VectorIntf> clusterCenters)
        Specified by:
        clusterVectors in interface ClustererIntf
        Returns:
        List // Vector<VectorIntf center>
        Throws:
        ClustererException - if at some iteration, one or more clusters becomes empty and the "projectonempty" property is true

        public int[] getClusterCards()
                      throws ClustererException
        return an int[] specifying the cardinalities of each cluster in the current clustering. The length of the returned array is equal to _centers.size(), namely the number of centers passed in during the call setInitialClustering(centers).

      • compactClusters

        private void compactClusters(double trycompacting)
                      throws ClustererException,
                             ParallelException
        break up any clusters that do not appear compact. The heuristic is the following: for any cluster that contains points that are more than 2.1*ave_dist away from the center, remove all points that are more than ave_dist away from their center, recompute the center, and assign the removed points to their nearest center
        Throws:
        ClustererException
        ParallelException

      • getCenters

        private static java.util.List getCenters(java.util.List docs,
                                         int[] clusterindices,
                                         int k)
                                  throws ClustererException
        compute the cluster centers of this clustering described in the args the clusterindices[] values range from [0...num_clusters-1].
        Parameters:

        k - int
